column4: how do X applications resolve color names like "black" is #000000?  since upgrading to dapper a number of my X apps are broken because they can't resolve the names
http://koala.ilog.fr/xpm-talk-hypermail/0736.html
thanks
hrm... I don't seem to have the rgb.dir and .pag binary versions... could that be my problem?
let me see if i have those
that link you gave me said xrgb is normally used to convert the text file into a binary one... I have the text file and it does define black... but no binary version
i have the .txt but not the .pag. i am on Edgy
an example of a program that complains about that?
emacs and gitk
funny thing is my system at home ran dapper throughout the development process and is nwo on edgy... never had this problem... I upgrade this server at work and this happens...
hm, hold on a second, i'm trying to install gitk but apparently my repositories are down right now
you got emacs installed?
nope
can you give me a quick hint on how to start/configure gitk? right now it complains it cannot find the .git directory
it is for showing history in a git repository... you need to check one out to inspect ;)
keep in mind he's using Hoary.
i don't know, i started with breezy. and i use KDE anyway :-)
were you able to run emacs or gitk?  if so do you have an RgbPath entry in the Files section of your xorg.conf?  found a thread sugesting that might be the problem... I don't have that entry
no, gitk left me on my own for configuring it, the man page being less than helpful, and emacs... brrr no, i'm not installing it :P
well, do you have an RgbPath entry in your xorg.conf?
no, nothing like that in my xorg.conf
yea... me neither... checked the xorg logs and it says it defaults to /etc/X11/rgb
